channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Apple shareholders reject proposal to scrap DEI program
item.description: Apple credits its DEI program as helping make the iPhone maker the most valuable company in the world.

item.title: 7 planets are aligning in the night sky for a "planetary parade"
item.description: Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Neptune and Uranus could be visible, but not all can be seen by the naked eye.

item.title: Consumer confidence falls the most since 2021 over fears about inflation and tariffs
item.description: A report from the Conference Board shows Americans are increasingly worried about inflation, driven in part by President Trump's threats to impose new...

item.title: Fabric giant Joann is going out of business and closing all of its 800 stores
item.description: The crafts retailer formerly known as Jo-Ann Fabrics had been struggling financially for several years following a DIY-driven uptick in sales during t...

item.title: New consumer confidence index data drops sharply
item.description: New data from the consumer confidence index shows a concerning drop in economic outlook among Americans. CBS MoneyWatch correspondent Kelly O'Grady re...

item.title: Nearly 40% of contracts canceled by DOGE are expected to produce no savings
item.description: Nearly 40% of the federal contracts that the Trump administration claims to have canceled as part of its signature cost-cutting program aren’t expecte...

item.title: Claims of white genocide 'not real', South African court rules
item.description: Donald Trump has been raising the alarm over the number of white farmers killed in the country.

item.title: Changes at the U.S.-Mexico border under Trump's new immigration policies
item.description: New data shows a dramatic drop in illegal border crossings as the Trump administration touts new changes at the U.S.-Mexico border. CBS News' Camilo M...

item.title: Illinois landlord charged with 2023 hate crime and murder of Palestinian American boy set for trial
US Supreme Court orders new trial for Oklahoma death row inmate Richard Glossip
item.description: Glossip has had nine execution dates postponed, and eaten his "last meal" three times.

item.title: In 'Legends and Soles,' the remarkable career of sports marketer Sonny Vaccaro is unveiled
item.description: NPR's A Martínez speaks with Sonny Vaccaro and Armen Keteyian about their new book, Legends and Soles, The Memoir of An American Original.

item.title: Syrian leader hails 'historic' dialogue conference
item.description: Hundreds are attending the event, which the interim president promised after ousting Bashar al-Assad.

item.title: The odds of a 'city-killer' asteroid hitting Earth have fallen to zero
item.description: After weeks at the top of the Sentry list at the Center for Near-Earth Object Studies, the asteroid 2024 YR4 is no longer considered a threat to Earth...

item.title: Jeff Probst on the evolution of "Survivor" as it enters season 48
item.description: Jeff Probst discussed how "Survivor" has evolved over 48 seasons and what changes have kept the show fresh.

item.title: Uganda probes death of Nigerian footballer in shopping mall
item.description: Abubakar Lawal, 29, reportedly fell from a third-floor balcony of a shopping mall in Kampala.

item.title: A midair collision in Arizona prompts questions about air traffic control towers
Regrets, executions and coups: Four takeaways from former Nigerian military ruler's book
item.description: Ibrahim Badamasi Babangida, known as IBB, has got Nigeria talking about the past and what might have been.

item.title: How is Pope Francis doing? The Vatican says he rested well and met church officials
item.description: Pope Francis "rested well throughout the night" in the hospital, the Vatican says, and even met with Vatican officials to sign several documents linke...
